content: https://github.com/alexcrichton/cc-rs/issues/663. Should we have it in rust-lang, just like regex?
We already have some things in place to designate specific maintainers for specific targets, cc-rs seems like an obvious extension to this idea to me.
I'm also wondering if we can move some of the per-target logic of cc-rs into rustc/cargo in some cases.
Like knowing what compiler to invoke for every target.

Any updates on this?
PRs to that crate do not land for almost 2 months, but it's a crate that requires regular maintenance to accommodate for tooling changes.

I'm interested in landing https://github.com/alexcrichton/cc-rs/pull/671 in particular, because https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93901 may break user builds in some cases, and those case may be annoying to fix without being able to modify cargo:rustc-link-lib directives emitted by cc-rs.
